content.description:
Schizophrenia Diagnosis by Income

The Percent of People Diagnosed with Schizophrenia data for the 2 bars are as follows:

Lowest Income: 2.5%

Highest Income: 0.5%

The graph shows a comparison of the percent of members of the lowest and highest income groups in the United States who are diagnosed with schizophrenia.
content.question: Psychologists from which of the following psychological perspectives would be most interested in this potential link to developing schizophrenia?

skill.text: 3.A: Identify psychology-related concepts in descriptions or representations of data.
